creator: j.c.yip@computer.org
text:
Many times, I find myself forgetting whether or not I've just done a build or 
I'm looking at an older result.  I've typically dealt with this by adding a 
tstamp output as part of the main target.  This is a bit of a hassle if there's 
more than one common target so I'm thinking that it would be useful if Ant 
itself would output the last build time by default.

creator: jan@materne.de
text:
I don´t think so. Printing out a lot of infos is annoying (and there are 
threads discussing that the 'BUILD SUCCESSFUL' is too much). 

So you can:
- add a <tstamp> and <echo> directly under the <project> element (possible
  since Ant 1.6). 
- write your own build listener
